comment.author: 34014149@N00
comment._content: Might be a long shot, but the building with the steeple in the lower right could be what is now  the Holy Trinity Church on the corner of North Terrace and Morphett St. Not sure when that was built but the layout seems to match.

comment.author: 92712677@N07
comment._content:
Holy Trinity Church - foundation stone laid  1837 - never had a steeple. It had a small tower, and later rebuilt larger. The location does seem about right but I think that church  is further up North Tce.

It was certainly not there in 1826. The first settlers arrived on the "Buffalo" in about Dec 1836.
I live in Adelaide and attend this church.

comment.author: 31575009@N05
comment._content: Thank you for your feedback. I have checked the date printed on the original document and it should have read 1845. I have corrected the description for this image and the rest in this set.

comment.author: 10187354@N05
comment._content: My grandparents lived in North Terrace around 1914 or so. I visited in 2010 and found the house they lived in was one of the few demolished to make way for a motel. :-(
